name: andy.lemin.io
body:
### Welcome to my page.
Just a little site to link my various other pages, projects and stuff together.

### Photo Blog
http://photos.lemin.io
Like all good Network Engineers, my main hobbbies are computer things, Rock Climbing, and Photography (oh and water sports, hiking etc).
I do not know why, nor do I really want to know, why so many network engineers are into these same hobbies!

This photo list is just a place to share my favourite pics with friends and family.

### Tech Blog
http://blog.lemin.io (Blogger)
I started my tech blog as an easy (lazy) way to keep notes and cheat sheets online for simple and mobile access.
It was never meant as a tutorial site, and so many of the wrttings are quite `dry` and dont hand-hold you through things. But "Sharing is Caring", so I made it public anyway.

If you are an experienced Network/Systems Engineer, these posts might be perfectly short, sweet and helpful.
If you are not experienced you will probably find most notes do not have enough detail to explain things, as they are about the how, rather than the why.
If you want the how, their is plenty of material and other blogs for that, which I wont duplicate.

### Code Repos
http://code.lemin.io
I am not a developer, repeat, I am not a devloper ;) - So pls dont chastise for code quality.
Whilst I used to develop a lot using Java, J2EE, MFC (showing my age) JavaScript, PHP etc, I do not dev anymore.

But as a Network Engineer with a passion for OpenSource, Automation, and DevOps, and a keen focus in Programable Networks, Overlays, WANs, Private Clouds (OpenStack), and Kubernetees/Mesos stacks etc. I do as a result still write lots of scripts including Bash, Python, Ruby (Puppet), Perl and Ansible (not technically a language).

Other lesser known favourite languages include LaTeX, MatLab, Spice (Electronics days) and a little bit of C/C++.
My repos are just a collection of scripts and settings I have written and found useful over the years.

### Authors and Contributors

### Contact
Here: andy.lemin.io
Twitter: @andylemin
FaceBook: face.lemin.io
